org.apache.juneau.serializer

Class SerializerContext

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.juneau.Context
      • org.apache.juneau.serializer.SerializerContext
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    JsonSerializerContext, MsgPackSerializerContext, RdfSerializerContext, UonSerializerContext, XmlSerializerContext

    public class SerializerContext
extends Context
    Parent class for all serializer contexts.
    Author:
    James Bognar (james.bognar@salesforce.com)

    • Field Detail

      • SERIALIZER_maxDepth

        public static final String SERIALIZER_maxDepth
        Max serialization depth (Integer, default=100).

        Abort serialization if specified depth is reached in the POJO tree. If this depth is exceeded, an exception is thrown. This prevents stack overflows from occurring when trying to serialize models with recursive references.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SERIALIZER_initialDepth

        public static final String SERIALIZER_initialDepth
        Initial depth (Integer, default=0).

        The initial indentation level at the root. Useful when constructing document fragments that need to be indented at a certain level.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SERIALIZER_detectRecursions

        public static final String SERIALIZER_detectRecursions
        Automatically detect POJO recursions (Boolean, default=false).

        Specifies that recursions should be checked for during serialization.

        Recursions can occur when serializing models that aren't true trees, but rather contain loops.

        The behavior when recursions are detected depends on the value for SERIALIZER_ignoreRecursions.

        For example, if a model contains the links A->B->C->A, then the JSON generated will look like the following when SERIALIZER_ignoreRecursions is true... {A:{B:{C:null}}}

        Note: Checking for recursion can cause a small performance penalty.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SERIALIZER_ignoreRecursions

        public static final String SERIALIZER_ignoreRecursions
        Ignore recursion errors (Boolean, default=false).

        Used in conjunction with SERIALIZER_detectRecursions. Setting is ignored if SERIALIZER_detectRecursions is false.

        If true, when we encounter the same object when serializing a tree, we set the value to null. Otherwise, an exception is thrown.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SERIALIZER_debug

        public static final String SERIALIZER_debug
        Debug mode (Boolean, default=false).

        Enables the following additional information during serialization:

        • When bean getters throws exceptions, the exception includes the object stack information in order to determine how that method was invoked.
        • Enables SERIALIZER_detectRecursions.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SERIALIZER_useIndentation

        public static final String SERIALIZER_useIndentation
        Use indentation in output (Boolean, default=false).

        If true, newlines and indentation is added to the output to improve readability.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SERIALIZER_addClassAttrs

        public static final String SERIALIZER_addClassAttrs
        Add class attributes to output (Boolean, default=false).

        If true, then "_class" attributes will be added to beans if their type cannot be inferred through reflection. This is used to recreate the correct objects during parsing if the object types cannot be inferred. For example, when serializing a Map<String,Object> field, where the bean class cannot be determined from the value type.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SERIALIZER_quoteChar

        public static final String SERIALIZER_quoteChar
        Quote character (Character, default='"').

        This is the character used for quoting attributes and values.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SERIALIZER_trimNullProperties

        public static final String SERIALIZER_trimNullProperties
        Trim null bean property values from output (Boolean, default=true).

        If true, null bean values will not be serialized to the output.

        Note that enabling this setting has the following effects on parsing:

        • Map entries with null values will be lost.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SERIALIZER_trimEmptyLists

        public static final String SERIALIZER_trimEmptyLists
        Trim empty lists and arrays from output (Boolean, default=false).

        If true, empty list values will not be serialized to the output.

        Note that enabling this setting has the following effects on parsing:

        • Map entries with empty list values will be lost.
        • Bean properties with empty list values will not be set.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SERIALIZER_trimEmptyMaps

        public static final String SERIALIZER_trimEmptyMaps
        Trim empty maps from output (Boolean, default=false).

        If true, empty map values will not be serialized to the output.

        Note that enabling this setting has the following effects on parsing:

        • Bean properties with empty map values will not be set.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SERIALIZER_trimStrings

        public static final String SERIALIZER_trimStrings
        Trim strings in output (Boolean, default=false).

        If true, string values will be trimmed of whitespace using String.trim() before being serialized.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SERIALIZER_relativeUriBase

        public static final String SERIALIZER_relativeUriBase
        URI base for relative URIs (String, default="").

        Prepended to relative URIs during serialization (along with the SERIALIZER_absolutePathUriBase if specified. (i.e. URIs not containing a schema and not starting with '/'). (e.g. "foo/bar")

        Examples:
        SERIALIZER_relativeUriBaseURISerialized URI
        http://foo:9080/bar/baz mywebapp http://foo:9080/bar/baz/mywebapp
        http://foo:9080/bar/baz /mywebapp /mywebapp
        http://foo:9080/bar/baz http://mywebapp http://mywebapp
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SERIALIZER_sortCollections

        public static final String SERIALIZER_sortCollections
        Sort arrays and collections alphabetically before serializing (Boolean, default=false).

        Note that this introduces a performance penalty.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SERIALIZER_sortMaps

        public static final String SERIALIZER_sortMaps
        Sort maps alphabetically before serializing (Boolean, default=false).

        Note that this introduces a performance penalty.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SERIALIZER_absolutePathUriBase

        public static final String SERIALIZER_absolutePathUriBase
        URI base for relative URIs with absolute paths (String, default="").

        Prepended to relative absolute-path URIs during serialization. (i.e. URIs starting with '/'). (e.g. "/foo/bar")

        Examples:
        SERIALIZER_absolutePathUriBaseURISerialized URI
        http://foo:9080/bar/baz mywebapp mywebapp
        http://foo:9080/bar/baz /mywebapp http://foo:9080/bar/baz/mywebapp
        http://foo:9080/bar/baz http://mywebapp http://mywebapp
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

        Constructor.
